intro: Pentaglossum linifolium, commonly known as the silverleaf pentaglossum, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and flowering structures. The plant features finely divided, silvery-gray leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family, and are often white or pale green.
